name: 2,6-dimethyl-4H-pyran-4-thione
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4301
Reason: 2,6-dimethyl-4H-pyran-4-thione has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for this compound is pyran, which has a melting point around 106°C. The methyl groups (two in total) add approximately +10 due to increasing the molecular weight and rigidity of the structure. The thione group introduces a sulfur atom, which can participate in hydrogen bonding and rigidify the structure, adding about +10. The methyl group in the thione group can also contribute to the melting point due to its effect on the crystal lattice, estimated at around +5.
